snippet: John Kerry met with the leaders of Jordan, Israel and the Palestinian Authority to discuss the site known to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary and to Jews as Temple Mount.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry is optimistic after meeting with leaders of Jordan, Israel and, separately, Pres Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority, that strife over volatile holy site in Old City of Jerusalem can be eased; site is revered by Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary, and by Jews as Temple Mount.

byline.original: By RANA F. SWEIS and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Rana F. Sweis reported from Amman, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: John Kerry met with the leaders of Jordan, Israel and the Palestinian Authority to discuss the site known to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary and to Jews as Temple Mount.

headline.main: Kerry Is Optimistic After Meeting Over Holy Site in Jerusalem
headline.print_headline: Kerry Is Optimistic After Meeting Over Holy Site in Jerusalem
